bibl.title: Letter from Domingo Romeu y Jaime to George A. Kellogg, August 7, 1941

div1.p: Jaime approves of Cornwell's painting, "Conquerors of Yellow Fever."

div1.head: Letter from Domingo Romeu y Jaime to George A. Kellogg, August 7, 1941
div1.opener:
Dr. Hench
TRANSLATION OF LETTER FROM: CONSUL OF EL SALVADOR
HAVANA, CUBA
August 7, 1941
Mr. George A. Kellogg
Jersey City
My distinguished friend:
div1.p:
I received with much pleasure your letter of the 28th of last month together
with the prints representing the painting of our dear friend, Dean Cornwell
which is a magnificent work as one can appreciate from the whole of the same
in the way in which it has been printed.

In regard to the matter of Dr. Finlay, his expression seems to be very
realistic and he is as we actually know him.

I thank you for your favor to myself and anxiously await the reproduction of
such an interesting painting which you so kindly offer me with which will be
seen the work you did together with Dr. Finlay, your noble and generous
collaborators and the Government of the United States, giving preferred attention
to the campaign initiated then against Yellow Fever.
I give you my most sincere thanks and am
div1.closer:
Yours very truly Domingo Romeu y Jaime RM:DR
August 13, 1941
P. S. I enclose letter of Mr. Dean Cornwell. Please
give it to him. Thanks very much.
